home.title: Bringing the eSports to your Discord server!

build.title: Build your Dream Team and Compete in Ranked Matches
build.desc: Build your Dream Team is too easy. Just run the command /claim to claim a random player, /promote to promote him to active roster and /roster to see your roster.

cards.title: Giant Diversity of Cards
cards.desc: There are {size} different cards to use and get by using /claim or buy by using /sign.

realtime.title: Get Real-Time Live Matches Information
realtime.desc: Get real-time live information on your favorite teams.

admin.description: See the dashboard and change the bot language

activatekey.description: Activate your premium key on a server

language.description: Change the language that I interact with you, overriding the language set on the server

live.description: Enable and disable the live feed feature

news.description: Enable and disable the news feature

premium.description: See informations about your premium plan

promote.description: Promote a player to active roster

leaderboard.description: Check the leaderboard of predictions, rating, and coins

remove.description: Remove a player from active roster

claims.description: Check your claims and your pity

remind.description: Enable/disable the reminder for when you can use /claim again.

metadata.title: Sabine | Your VALORANT simulator
metadata.desc: Dive into a VALORANT/League of Legends bot with statistics, predictions, live scores, betting and more.

introduction.title: Introduction to Tournament, predictions and results
introduction.description: This feature lets you track Valorant and League of Legends matches, make predictions, and view the results.

tournaments.title: Adding Tournaments
tournaments.description: To add a Valorant or League of Legends tournament, you must use /tournament add, select the game, select the matches channel and select the results channel. It is highly recommended that the matches channel be a channel where members cannot send messages and only Sabine's message flow is allowed.

predictions.title: Making Predictions
predictions.description: To make a prediction, you must to go to the matches channel and look for the Sabine's message. After that, look for the Predict button and make your prediction.

bets.title: Making Bets
bets.description: To make a bet, you must go to the matches channel and look for the Sabine's message. You must also have at least 500 coins to make a bet. After that, look for the Bet button and make your bet.

introduction.title: Introduction to Simulator
introduction.description: The simulator is a unique experience. Build your roster with players of different skill levels, duel against opponents, and prove you have what it takes to lead your team to the top. Every decision matters — victory depends on your team level!

how_it_works.title: How it Works
how_it_works.description: Each match in the simulator is resolved based on your players' stats and a bit of luck. The stronger and more balanced your team is, the higher your chances of winning. To duel against someone, your team must have 5 players on active roster. After that, you can use /duel to duel agains someone.

players.title: Players
players.description: Every player in the simulator has a overall and unique attributes like aim, headshot, movement, aggression, ACS, and game sense. You can buy and sell players you do not want. Some players are rarer and perform better in clutch situations. Claim a random player by using /claim.

matches.title: Matches
matches.description: Matches are played in a BO1 format and whoever scores 13 points first wins. You can track your recent results and matches by using /career.

progress.title: Progression and Ranking
progress.description: Winning matches earns you points and helps your team climb the global leaderboard. The higher you go, the more recognition you gain — and stronger players might want to join your roster. Rankings are updated regularly, and the best teams get featured.

introduction.title: Introduction to Cards
introduction.description: All players' stats are taken from the website thespike.gg.

calc.title: Attributes Calculation
calc.description: AIM: (KPR * 40) + (HS% * 1.8) HS: HS% * 2 MOV: (1.5 - DPR) * 80 AGG: (FBPR * 250) + (KPR * 15) ACS: ACS / 3 GMS: (APR * 150) + (FBSR * 0.6) After the calculation, most players get manually adjusted buffs and debuffs based on the tier they play in.

attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: AIM: Self-explanatory HS: Self-explanatory MOV: Movement AGG: Aggression ACS: Average Score Combat GMS: Game Sense

introduction.title: Introduction to Meta Agents
introduction.description: Just like in Valorant, each map has its meta agents, and the simulator is no different. Here you can check the meta agents for each map to avoid debuffs on your players.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.description:
Last Update: 8/7/2025

This website does not collect, store, or share any personal information.
We do not use cookies, tracking tools, or analytics services.
Our site’s sole purpose is to display features of our Discord bot.
If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, you can contact us via Discord in our official server.

terms.title: Terms of Use
terms.description:
Last Update: September 2, 2025

Welcome to Sabine, a Discord bot developed for tracking matches, making predictions and providing entertainment related to Valorant and League of Legends. By using our bot, you agree to the following terms.

acceptance.title: Acceptance
acceptance.description:
By using Sabine, you agree to comply with these Terms of Use. If you do not agree with any part, do not use the bot.

Violating these terms will result in your Discord account being suspended from using the bot.

usage.title: Bot Usage
usage.description:
• The bot is for recreational and entertainment purposes only.
  • You agree not to use the bot for illegal or harmful purposes or in violation of Discord rules.
  • You are responsible for all actions of your Discord account while using the bot.

content.title: Content
content.description:
• Sabine provides information, statistics, and match results.
  • The bot is not responsible for losses or damages resulting from real money bets, predictions, or decisions based on the bot.

restrictions.title: Restrictions
restrictions.description:
• You agree not to modify, copy, or redistribute the bot.
  • Premium features may require payment.
  • Excessive or abusive use may result in suspension or ban from the bot.

privacy.title: Privacy
privacy.description:
• The bot collects basic Discord data (username, ID, messages necessary for features).
  • Data is used only to provide the bot's functionalities and is not sold to third parties.

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
disclaimer.description:
• The bot is provided “as is”.
  • We do not guarantee uninterrupted availability or error-free performance.
  • Any decision based on the bot’s information is solely your responsibility.

changes.title: Changes
changes.description:
• We may update or modify these terms at any time.
  • Continued use of the bot after changes implies acceptance of the new terms.

guidelines.title: Guidelines
guidelines.description: Sabine's goal to bring eSports and entertainment to you and your Discord server. To do this, you must follow some rules to avoid having your account suspended from using the bot.
guidelines.subtitle: The following actions will not be tolerated
guidelines.guidelines:
• Not following Discord guidelines.
  • Exploiting bugs or system glitches.
  • Using secondary/alt accounts for personal gain, such as trading players with yourself, playing matches against yourself to climb the leaderboard faster, etc.
  • Selling, renting, or trading coins/cards for real money or any item of real-world monetary value. If this happens, report it to our team.
  • Attempting to evade or bypass punishments. Evading your suspension (creating or using another account to use Sabine) will result in your suspension not being lifted.
  • Attempting to attack, harm, or take down Sabine.
  • We are not responsible for accounts that are sold, borrowed, gifted, hacked, etc. The responsibility for what happens with your account lies with you. If someone else uses your account to break the rules, you will be the one banned, since the account belongs to you.
